thread.title: LeBron James captures Christmas moments with Savannah James & Bronny's siblings in matching red outfits
thread.title_full: LeBron James captures Christmas moments with Savannah James & Bronny's siblings in matching red outfits

author: Avi Shravan
title: LeBron James captures Christmas moments with Savannah James & Bronny's siblings in matching red outfits
text:

LeBron James captures Christmas moments with Savannah James & Bronnyâ€™s siblings in matching red outfits Discuss Now LeBron James captures Christmas moments with Savannah James & Bronnyâ€™s siblings in matching red outfits. (Credits: IMAGN) LeBron James shared his family's Christmas celebrations with his 159 million followers on Instagram. The Lakers superstar posted pictures from the auspicious day on his handle.
He accompanied his thoughts and warm Christmas wishes in the caption of his upload.
"MERRY CHRISTMAS FROM THE JAMES GANG TO YOURS!!! ðŸ‘‘âœ¨âœ¨âœ¨ " â€¢

The post featured four pictures, all of which were the same but with slight differences. In the pictures, the James family - Savannah James, Bronny James , Bryce James and the youngest Zhuri James - wore similar clothes.
All five members wore red pajamas with miniature designs on them. King James and his wife stand behind their kids while Bronny stands to their right and Bryce stands to their left. Zhuri occupied the space in the middle and in front of her mother.
LeBron James delivered a spectacular performance against the Golden State Warriors on Wednesday. The Lakers played the Dubs in a Christmas Day game, with Bron and Steph Curry putting on a great show reminiscent of their performance in the 2016 NBA Finals. James scored a double-double, netting 31 points, four rebounds and 10 assists.
The Dubs put on a great fight, but Austin Reaves 's last-minute game-winner sealed the win for the LA side. The Lakers won the matchup with a final score of 115-113.
LeBron James calls out NFL during post-game interview on Christmas Day After the 115-113 win against the Warriors on Christmas Day at the Chase Center, LeBron James gave a post-game interview in which he called out the NFL. The NFL was also running high-profile matches in the same time slots as the NBA, resulting in a split in viewership. However, after a spectacular performance, King James proclaimed that Christmas Day belongs to the NBA.
"I love the NFL but Christmas is our day," James said. (1:28) King James also praised the Warriors star Steph Curry and talked about the great performances they have been delivering together over the years.
"Today is a day of giving and me and that's what me and Steph continue to do and try to do for our fans, for our beautiful game so yeah big shout out to AR (Austin Reaves) though, that was big time," James said. The LA Lakers are having a good run under JJ Redick, their new coach. They have a 17-13 record and are in the sixth spot in the Western Conference standings.
